com.kuka.device.common

Class PositionInformation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kuka.device.common.PositionInformation

  • public class PositionInformation
extends Object
    Provides information of the measured and commanded Cartesian and joint positions of a frame under the flange of a robot.

    Instance of the class is usually provided when motion is stopped by stop condition (as part of of IFiredConditionInfo) or trigger (as a part of IFiredTriggerInfo) is fired. In these cases it represents a position of a frame used to command a motion.
    The reference coordinate system in this case is the global root of the scene graph i.e. SpatialObject.getRootFrame().

    It is also possible to directly request PositionInformation for a frame under the flange of a robot.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new instance of type PositionInformation with given Cartesian and joint position data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LocalFrame getCommandedCartesianPosition()
      Get the LocalFrame representing the commanded Cartesian position of the frame for which the PositionInformation was requested.
      JointPosition getCommandedJointPosition()
      Get the commanded joint position of the specified frame, may be null.
      LocalFrame getCurrentCartesianPosition()
      Get the LocalFrame representing the current (measured) Cartesian position of the frame for which the PositionInformation was requested.
      JointPosition getCurrentJointPosition()
      Get the current (measured) joint position of the specified frame, may be null.
      boolean hasJointPositions()
      True if joint positions are stored in this information set, false otherwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PositionInformation

        public PositionInformation(LocalFrame currentCartesianPosition,
                           LocalFrame commandedCartesianPosition,
                           JointPosition currentJointPosition,
                           JointPosition commandedJointPosition)
        Creates a new instance of type PositionInformation with given Cartesian and joint position data.

        The Cartesian position data refers to a specified frame in the frame tree of a device with a specified reference frame as parent.

        Parameters:
        currentCartesianPosition - The current Cartesian position as LocalFrame. null is allowed
        commandedCartesianPosition - The commanded Cartesian position as LocalFrame. null is allowed
        currentJointPosition - The current joint position as JointPosition. null is allowed
        commandedJointPosition - The commanded joint position as JointPosition. null is allowed

    • Method Detail

      • hasJointPositions

        public boolean hasJointPositions()
        True if joint positions are stored in this information set, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True if joint positions are stored in this information set, false otherwise.

      • getCurrentCartesianPosition

        public LocalFrame getCurrentCartesianPosition()
        Get the LocalFrame representing the current (measured) Cartesian position of the frame for which the PositionInformation was requested.

        The parent of this LocalFrame is usually global root of the scene graph i.e. SpatialObject.getRootFrame() or a given reference frame, depending on how this PositionInformation was requested.

        Returns:
        The current position as LocalFrame with optional redundancy information.

      • getCommandedCartesianPosition

        public LocalFrame getCommandedCartesianPosition()
        Get the LocalFrame representing the commanded Cartesian position of the frame for which the PositionInformation was requested.

        The parent of this LocalFrame is usually global root of the scene graph i.e. SpatialObject.getRootFrame() or a given reference frame, depending on how this PositionInformation was requested.

        Returns:
        The commanded position as LocalFrame with optional redundancy information.

      • getCurrentJointPosition

        public JointPosition getCurrentJointPosition()
        Get the current (measured) joint position of the specified frame, may be null.
        Returns:
        The current position as JointPosition.

      • getCommandedJointPosition

        public JointPosition getCommandedJointPosition()
        Get the commanded joint position of the specified frame, may be null.
        Returns:
        The commanded position as JointPosition.
